src.experiments.word_rec module¶

This module provides a script to evaluate the WER and CER of a model.

Example:

python3 src/experiments/word_rec.py \
path/to/state_dict \
path/to/dir_out \
dset_name \
path/to/dset_annotations \
path/to/imgs \
--gpu_idx=cuda:0 \
--estimator=cosine

For options have a look at src.parser.args_parser.parser_inference()


src.experiments.word_rec.run_word_rec(net: src.nn.phocnet.PHOCNet, dset: src.io.dataloader.DSetPhoc, estimator: src.estimation.base.Estimator, device=None, n_codes_lvl=0, debug=False)[source]¶

This method performs the main word recognition and returns error rates in a JSON serilizable dictionary

Parameters

  • net – PHOCNet instance

  • dset – Test Data to evaluate on

  • estimator – Estimator, used for estimation

  • device – GPU device

  • n_codes_lvl – Level to extract neural codes from, 0 is equivalent to a normal forward pass

  • debug – There will be no output written, but a sample of up to 400 estimated words and respective transcriptions printed, if debug is set to True

  • scale – Scale of images

Returns

A dictionary containing the tatoal character and word erros, as well as the means/ proportional errors.

src.experiments.word_rec.save(dir_out, json_dict, name)[source]¶

This method handles saving the errors to json files

Parameters

  • dir_out – Directory to save output file at

  • json_dict – JSON object/ dictionary containing the errors

  • name – The output files name
